DOC.brief_summary: This human inpatient clinical pharmacology study assess potential interaction intravenous ( i.v . ) methamphetamine infusion oral osmotic release methylphenidate ( OROS-MPH ) . The primary objective study determine safety OROS-MPH concurrent i.v . d-methamphetamine infusion 15 mg 30 mg. Safety outcome measure include cardiovascular response [ heart rate ( HR ) , blood pressure ( BP ) , electrocardiograph ( ECG ) measurement ] , oral temperature , adverse event ( AEs ) , clinical laboratory analysis .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Assessment Potential Interactions Between IV Methamphetamine Osmotic-Release Methylphenidate ( OROS-MPH )
